question: How many characters should be used to refer to a commit?

answers.feedback: A minimum of the first 8 to 10 characters is sufficiently unique.
Too few characters to guarantee uniqueness.
This is will work but it is unnecessarily large.

answers.answer: The project is saved at the point in time.
Code is added to the repository and tracked.
answers.feedback: git add tracks files in the repository.

answers.answer: The project is saved in GitHub.
answers.feedback: git push saves a project to GitHub.
Commits save code at a point in time, previous code is not deleted.

answers.answer: All deleted files are permanently removed from the repository.
answers.feedback: Deleted files are retained in previous commits.

question: After adding to the README file, you decide that the change was unnecessary. What do you do to return to the previous README?

answers.feedback: git revert returns a file to previous commit.

answers.answer: Edit the README and git add and commit.
answers.feedback: This is works but is inefficient.
git fix is not a command.
git reset deletes commits after and including the commit
